The '''Rhimdath''' or '''Rushdown''' was a short, early tributary of the [[Anduin]] River.

==Course==
It flowed from the its source on the eastern side of the [[Misty Mountains]] southeastward for about 25 miles until its confluence with an unnamed tributary that also flowed down from the Misty Mountains. The Rushdown then continued 25 miles southeastward until its confluence with the Anduin roughly halfway between the [[Langwell]]-[[Greylin]] confluence and the [[Carrock]].<ref>{{FR|Map}}</ref> Given the name "Rushdown" it probably had a steep gradient.

==Other versions of the legendarium==
The river Rhimdath is unnamed on the [[Map of Wilderland]] in the ''[[The Hobbit]]'', ''[[The Third Map of The Lord of the Rings]]'', the [[General Map of Middle-earth]] and [[The West of Middle-earth at the End of the Third Age]] map. 

[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] added the names "''Rhimdath''" and "Rushdown" in pencil on the [[Map of Wilderland]] in one of his copies of ''[[The Hobbit]]''.<ref name=RS>{{RS|1XIc}}, footnote â€ , p. 205</ref> He also added the names "R.Rushdown" and "(Rhimdad)" on [[The First Map of The Lord of the Rings]].<ref>{{TI|MII}}, map square J-12, p. 305</ref> The name "Rushdown" also appears on a late map of the northern part of Middle-earth drawn by J.R.R. Tolkien.<ref>W.G. Hammond & C. Scull, ''The Art of the lord of the Rings'', HarperCollins, 2015, p. 202, Fig. 159. Map of the northern part of Middle-earth, square I-5.</ref>

==Etymology==
''Rhimdath'' is a [[Noldorin]] name. The first element in ''Rhimdath'' is related to [[Noldorin]] ''[[rhib-]]'', ''[[rhimp]]'', ''rhimmo'' ("to flow like a [?torrent]"), derived from the [[Sundocarme|stem]] [[RIP|RIP-]] ("rush, fly, fling").<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry '''RIP-''', p. 384</ref> As the stem [[DAT|DAT-]] is glossed as "fall down",<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 354</ref> it is possible that the second element in ''Rhimdath'' is a derivative of this stem.<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-3656807887.html|articlename=N. ''Rhimdad'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=27 September 2024}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2021: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Originating in the [[Misty Mountains]], Rhimdath forms a large mountain lake before dropping below and continuing its flow east. The lake is home to "Lyndelby", a village of [[Fallohides]] that remains isolated from the larger world and is protected by the [[Great Eagles]] who maintain its secret.
